page.title: 12CHANGING FACE OF SESSAY 2
page.content: {(Continued from p.11) Now people move in from outside the village, many to retire. In the future it is much less likely that people will live out their whole lives from cradle to grave here. {Buildings too change: older ones are houses built in local materials; newer ones tend to be red-brick bungalows. These are just a few of the numerous changes taking place. In its truest sense a village is a community. In the past, the relative isolation and limited occupations shaped that community. The{communications revolution}has changed the world and Sessay has not remained immune. To survive as more than a dormitory for nearby towns, Sessay, like thousands of similar villages, will need to keep, albeit altered by circumstance, that sense of being an{individual community.
